instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that doesn't boot.
It has green light, fan spin, consumes 1.200A w/o battery connected, CPU gets hot, but doesn't power on.

Shall I disable GPU?

All big coils have voltages, except L7550, that has 0V.

Diode reading on L7550 = 0.010

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
L7510 final voltage?
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high?

So easy to disable GPU on this board; consider it as must check option.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
L7510: 
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL> = 1.160V

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH1_L</SIGNAL> = 1.269V

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  = 3.346V

I've disabled GPU with medusa, removed <RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR>, but same result.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
VCORE should drop to 0.75V when board boots.
Tried different RAM modules?
Do you have DDR3 test card for slots?

Did you remove <RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR> before aplying power to the board?
If not, do BIOS mod again.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
You're write. 
It was a mix of RAM and GPU failure.
Tks.
